main event: Multiple UFO sightings in Lexington, Kentucky, including sightings of small, white, oval objects and a round light 15-30 feet from the ground with no exhaust, noise, flame, or vapor trail observed.
interesting points: One to five oval, shiny objects were sighted, with one making a 72-degree dive to 5,000 ft, hovering, and then diving straight down and disappearing from sight.
The observed object or objects do not fit the usual factors associated with this type of case, indicating an unidentifiable type of phenomenon.
A sighting by Mrs. (redacted) near Indianapolis describes a round light 15-30 feet from the ground with no exhaust, noise, flame, or vapor trail observed.
Another report describes an object moving from north to south, changing direction quickly and exhibiting rapid acceleration, with no insignia or identification observed.
The observed objects would fade and grow in magnitude, reaching a size about 5,000 ft, with some appearing as small stars and then growing several thousand m.p.h. in speed.
sighted object: small, white, oval objects and a round light 15-30 feet from the ground
location: Lexington, Kentucky and near Indianapolis, Indiana
witnesses: Capt. from U.S. Flight Service, Mrs. (redacted), and multiple other observers
